pullRequest.body:
See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/The.20Taylor.20series.20of.20an.20entire.20function.20converges.20to.20it/near/417334632) on Zulip.

This adds some general lemmas due to Junyan Xu, culminating in
```lean
theorem HasFPowerSeriesOnBall.hasSum_iteratedFDeriv {ùïú : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {E : Type*}
    [ NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ùïú E] {F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup F]
    [NormedSpace ùïú F] {p : FormalMultilinearSeries ùïú E F} {f : E ‚Üí F} {x : E} {r : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû}
    (h : HasFPowerSeriesOnBall f p x r) [CompleteSpace F] [CharZero ùïú] {y : E} (hy : y ‚àà EMetric.ball 0 r) :+1:
    HasSum (fun n ‚Ü¶ (n ! : ùïú)‚Åª¬π‚Ä¢ (iteratedFDeriv ùïú n f x) fun x ‚Ü¶ y) (f (x + y))
```
and uses this to show that the Taylor series of a function that is complex differentiable on an open ball in ‚ÑÇ converges there to the function; similarly for functions that are holomorphic on all of ‚ÑÇ:
```lean
lemma Complex.hasSum_taylorSeries_on_ball {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚ÑÇ E]
    [CompleteSpace E] ‚¶Éf : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí E‚¶Ñ ‚¶Éc : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ ‚¶Ér : NNReal‚¶Ñ (hf : DifferentiableOn ‚ÑÇ f (Metric.ball c ‚Üër)) ‚¶Éz : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ
    (hz : z ‚àà Metric.ball c ‚Üër) :
    HasSum (fun n ‚Ü¶ (n ! : ‚ÑÇ)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (z - c) ^ n ‚Ä¢ iteratedDeriv n f c) (f z)

lemma Complex.taylorSeries_eq_on_ball {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚ÑÇ E]
    [CompleteSpace E] ‚¶Éf : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí E‚¶Ñ ‚¶Éc : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ ‚¶Ér : NNReal‚¶Ñ (hf : DifferentiableOn ‚ÑÇ f (Metric.ball c ‚Üër)) ‚¶Éz : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ
    (hz : z ‚àà Metric.ball c ‚Üër) : 
    ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), (n ! : ‚ÑÇ)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (z - c) ^ n ‚Ä¢ iteratedDeriv n f c = f z

lemma Complex.taylorSeries_eq_on_ball' ‚¶Éc : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ ‚¶Ér : NNReal‚¶Ñ ‚¶Éz : ‚ÑÇ‚¶Ñ (hz : z ‚àà Metric.ball c ‚Üër) {f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ}
    (hf : DifferentiableOn ‚ÑÇ f (Metric.ball c ‚Üër)) : 
    ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), (n ! : ‚ÑÇ)‚Åª¬π * iteratedDeriv n f c * (z - c) ^ n = f z
```
and similar lemmas for `EMetric.ball`s and entire functions.

---

nodes.body:
Thanks!
maintainer merge
Disclaimer: I wrote the parts in the files **other than** [Analysis/Complex/TaylorSeries.lean](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10087/files#diff-c211aec3c9f487f72fc1d380dfa2e8ef337cc52f633d2fdda508af03638d7c9c)
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7739155072/job/21101421830)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7739155072/job/21101421591)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7739155072/job/21101421094)
LGTM otherwise
LGTM otherwise

I'm a little bit sad with this lemma, as its statement is not the right one: the right statement is that `iteratedFDeriv ùïú n f x v` (where `v` doesn't have to be constant) is equal to the sum over all permutations `sigma` of `p n (v (sigma 1), ..., v (sigma n))`. When you specialize to a constant `v`, you get your formula, but it's impossible to recover the general formula from your lemma in general (in particular in positive characteristic). Is there a hope to get the general formula using your approach?
Maybe @alreadydone can comment on that (I was taking the code they proposed on Zulip basically as-is).

@sgouezel Yes that's exactly what I was saying [here on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/The.20Taylor.20series.20of.20an.20entire.20function.20converges.20to.20it/near/418229884). I was able to formulate `factorial_smul` immediately after seeing @MichaelStollBayreuth's Zulip question, but it took more time to convince myself that the stronger statement is also true. I have now formulated the stronger statement [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/symmetrize_changeOrigin_eq_iteratedDeriv?expand=1#diff-afc1a6ce1a23be3624955d95e5804e193249ed762e40bc3f4adf5cecc0cb9822R105-R107) and it shouldn't be too hard to prove by induction, but have not yet found time to tackle the proof, and I realized I should extract an equality between two series, and generalize `symmetrize` to arbitrary DistribMulAction (by a group) on an AddCommMonoid (people may have defined this this when doing group cohomology / representation ...). I agree that the current proof is a "hack" and should be refactor using the stronger statement.
So would it be OK to go ahead with this PR and do the refactor later?
That's fine with me!
Now that we've made this a def, we should probably use this def in statements (for example `HasFPowerSeriesOnBall.fderiv`) as much as possible.
But maybe not in this PR...

There are just three occurrences:
`HasFPowerSeriesOnBall.fderiv`
`HasFiniteFPowerSeriesOnBall.fderiv`
`HasFiniteFPowerSeriesOnBall.fderiv'`
where the long expression can be replaced by `p.derivSeries`.
OK.

```suggestion
/-- `derivSeries p` is a power series for `fderiv ùïú f` if `p` is a power series for `f`,
see `HasFPowerSeriesOnBall.fderiv`. -/
```
and can you please move this to Analytic/Basic right after changeOrigin_radius?
OK.

```suggestion
    iteratedFDeriv ùïú 0 f x = p 0 := by
```
OK.
Can you add versions with `EMetric.ball`? And why not allow `r` to be a real? EMetric.ball takes an ENNReal but Metric.ball takes a Real.
Done.
I ask because you should be able to use EMetric.ball with infinite radius here ...
